comment: Extremely rude professor. He will yell at you if you don't understand something. Chem lab is an easy class but he is just not pleasant to be around and very unhelpful. Do not recommend ever taking unless you want to be yelled at in a thick Russian accent for being less than 5 minutes early.

Overall he was a great professor, he was very helpful and clear, he made sure that we didn't leave class until he checked our labs and made sure that our calculations were done correctly, and after a while you get used to his ways.

At the beginning his accent can be confusing but you quickly get used to it. Overall the class is easy. He puts how to do all the labs on the board. Just ask the TA if you can't understand him. He can seem intimitating but if you ask him a question he will help you. Just make sure you're always on time and you'll be fine. Should be an easy A.

VERY hard to understand his accent. You'll end up heavily relying on the TA and your lab partner. Very strict grader on some days. If you ask help from him he will makes you feel inferior in front of the class, so you'll end up relying on the TA a lot more. The TA is the life saver of this class, but I would not recommend him for Lab.

This teacher is probably the worst teacher as Kennesaw. You will not even understand him. His grading is to the extreme meaning, if you miss a zero after a decimal he will deduct 2 points off your lab paper. I seriously don't even know how he got a job here at Kennesaw.
So unhelpful and unclear. Impossible to understand. Does not answer questions. If you ask a question, you WILL be made feel dumb. Avoid at ALL costs.

Thick accent but you get used to it. However, extremely rude. If you are unclear and ask for his help he gets frustrated and makes you feel stupid. He gets so frustrated he doesn't see clearly. I had to continuously point to my lab book and show him my answer that he said was not there. Your TA will be a life saver if you take him.
There is definitely a language barrier there. Hope that you have a good TA because he is not very helpful. Tough grader but you can pull out a B if you do everything. Would not take again.

EVERYONE that has commented for Dr. Sheynker probably went in thinking it was just lab, no big deal. Yes he is strict in what he wants, but come on. You're paying for the class, just show up with proper attire and materials and he won't have a problem. You will have a TA there if you do not understand him. This should be an easy A for anyone.

It was not an easy class but if you showed up and stayed on top of your work, you could get an A. He's a hard grader but it helps you on the final because you than know how to do the questions. Overall not the best teacher but you can achieve an A if you work for it.
I don't recommend him.. Unclear, difficult to understand, and not too helpful. VERY strict grader. Also, a major stickler for showing up right on time.

I would not recomment taking this professor especially if its your first semester. He is a VERY VERY strict grader,he is not very helpful and very unclear. He comes off very rude and has no patients. The TA will become your best friend if you have him.  I wouldnt take him again. I got a B in the class.

Really tough grader, especially in use with sig figs and calculations. He will check all of work in all of your labs, and is not always clear on how he wants things done. If you make it a point to show him you are interested in his class and SHOW him you are trying, he is pleasant enough. I have an A in the class, but would not take him again.

Don't take this guy. He is rude and unclear. He is very exact on how he wants things and takes points off of labs that don't even need to be considered. Me and my lab partner always got yelled at because something wasn't up to his standards. Too much. Take another teacher ...you will regret it and the TA can only help so many people at a time.
i had him for chem lab. i hated this class. no communication. had no interest in helping.
H.O.R.R.I.B.L.E. I promise you will regret ever taking him. Please drop the class now and save yourself the trouble!

Have definitely had better teachers. Has a thick Russian accent that is very difficult to understand. Grades very strictly and counts off for even the smallest error. Most of the assistance received came from the TA. He would also reference "Bosco" a couple times. Never found out what that was.
Had him for Chem1211 lab. Has a Russian accent. He's strict. If you don't do something right, he'd yell at you and make you feel low of yourself. Happened to me a few times.

HORRIBLE teacher! Disagreed with him on the first day about clarity of assignment and he hated me for the rest of the semester. Made me feel dumb for asking questions on homework. Without the TA I would have failed this class. SO unclear and counts off for the smallest error. Had to correct his grading sometimes because he miscalculated.
At first I did not like him. Once the semester progressed I loved the class and became used to his accent. He is really helpful and it is all around a simple class.

I've seen some comments about his incomprehensible accent. His accent is only incomprehensible in the first class, you'll be surprised how quickly you'll get used to it. And because English is not his first language, his explanation is actually simpler and more straight forward than an American Chemistry professor would give.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF! His accent can be impossible to understand even to someone who has studied German... The first day my lab partner and I were kicked out for not having all of the lab book even though there was no prior direction to do so. It was our first lab ever and he still gave us zeros for the whole day. Absolutely atrocious teaching!
He's a good professor!!

I would definitely not recommend this professor. I had him for lab. He grades assignments very strictly. He will not curve the impossibly hard final even though all the other teachers do! He will not return any emails - don't bother! Do not take him!!!

Let's just say if you dont know how to do something, DONT ASK.  He can be really rude and just walks away after insulting you. I had an A going into the final but got a B in the class.  It really depends on if youre the one person he likes.  do your work and dont make him mad!!

Accent is sometimes hard to understand but you'll get used to it. Nice professor willing to help out students. Explains lab procedures to the fullest and provides formulas and equations. Class is easy but time-consuming (2 hrs. 45 mins) but finishing labs allows you to leave early. Recommend
His class is very good.
No Comments
he is just the best prof not the best speaker but he's very helpful and i understand him better then all the others

Dr. Sheynker is given an incredibly hard time by his students. He is a very nice gentleman who tries to help everyone as much as possible.  He is fair and hardworking and given the chance can help people get through CHEM without hardships.
YOU WILL DO WELL ONLY IF YOU ARE SERIOUS. I RECIEVED AN ESAY "A". THE TA'S ARE  HELPFUL.
I can see why he would be hard in lecture, but his lab class was easy. Wasn't much help for explanations, but there's a TA in there anyways. He doesn't grade lab reports very strictly either.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFEESOR! He does not speak english. Lab attendance is mandatory, and his midterm and final are impossible. Even his TA goes against everything that he says. He marks off for minor scratch outs in your notebook, and grades to the .10 of a decimal. He has to have someone translate what he says half of the time! There were no A's!

He is difficult to understand - his accent reminds you of Borat. However, he is very nice and very intelligent. Many people regret having his class because of his accent. His tests are pretty hard. I would probably not recommend.

He is a terrible teacher!! I understood all of his lectures, even with his accent, but his tests didnt match his lectures. He doesnt write his own tests!! Everyone was failing and a lot of us had to withdraw. HE IS HORRIBLE!!
